article.title: Horizon fluff, semi-classical black hole microstates - Log-corrections to BTZ entropy and black hole/particle correspondence

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the wavy lines in Figure 1 represent?
choices: The trajectory of a particle falling into the black hole.
The singularity at the center of the black hole.
The event horizon of the black hole.

multiple_choice_question.text: What geometric object is represented by the circle in Figure 2?
choices: The event horizon of a black hole.
A constant time slice on global AdS3.
The trajectory of a particle on AdS3.

multiple_choice_question.text: What types of geometries are represented by points in the blue region of the right figure?
choices: Conic spaces and their Virasoro descendants.
Global AdS3 and its Virasoro descendants.
BTZ black holes and their Virasoro descendants.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does this formula represent? S = 2Ï€ ( J+0 + J-0 )
choices: The Bekenstein-Hawking entropy of a black hole in terms of its area.
The entropy of a black hole in terms of near horizon symmetry charges.
The temperature of a black hole in terms of its mass and angular momentum.
The angular momentum of a black hole in terms of its horizon area.
